critique: This document pertains to tax returns and their inspection by a Senate committee. It is difficult to assess its ideological tilt without more context, but it seems related to government oversight. Immigration is not addressed. Executive power is somewhat expanded by allowing inspection of tax returns, but it is also checked by the Senate committee's role. Federalism is not directly addressed. National security vs. civil liberties is a consideration, as tax information is private, but the order aims to ensure proper operation of the national-defense program. Economic regulation is indirectly addressed through tax oversight. Social inclusion is not directly addressed.
